intro: Siphocampylus capribarba, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone substrates, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its flowers are usually pale green or white with a subtle fragrance. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
